verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of Tyre <WH6865>. Howl <WH3213>, ye ships <WH591> of Tarshish <WH8659>; for it is laid waste <WH7703>, so that there is no house <WH1004>, no entering in <WH935>: from the land <WH776> of Chittim <WH3794> it is revealed <WH1540> to them.

Be still <WH1826>, ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the isle <WH339>; thou whom the merchants <WH5503> of Zidon <WH6721>, that pass over <WH5674> the sea <WH3220>, have replenished <WH4390>. still: Heb. silent
And by great <WH7227> waters <WH4325> the seed <WH2233> of Sihor <WH7883>, the harvest <WH7105> of the river <WH2975>, is her revenue <WH8393>; and she is a mart <WH5505> of nations <WH1471>.

Be thou ashamed <WH954>, O Zidon <WH6721>: for the sea <WH3220> hath spoken <WH559>, even the strength <WH4581> of the sea <WH3220>, saying <WH559>, I travail <WH2342> not, nor bring forth children <WH3205>, neither do I nourish up <WH1431> young men <WH970>, nor bring up <WH7311> virgins <WH1330>.
As at the report <WH8088> concerning Egypt <WH4714>, so shall they be sorely pained <WH2342> at the report <WH8088> of Tyre <WH6865>.
Pass ye over <WH5674> to Tarshish <WH8659>; howl <WH3213>, ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the isle <WH339>.

Is this your joyous <WH5947> city, whose antiquity <WH6927> is of ancient <WH6924> days <WH3117>? her own feet <WH7272> shall carry <WH2986> her afar off <WH7350> to sojourn <WH1481>. afar: Heb. from afar off

Who hath taken this counsel <WH3289> against Tyre <WH6865>, the crowning <WH5849> city, whose merchants <WH5503> are princes <WH8269>, whose traffickers <WH3667> are the honourable <WH3513> of the earth <WH776>?

The LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> hath purposed <WH3289> it, to stain <WH2490> the pride <WH1347> of all glory <WH6643>, and to bring into contempt <WH7043> all the honourable <WH3513> of the earth <WH776>. to stain: Heb. to pollute
Pass <WH5674> through thy land <WH776> as a river <WH2975>, O daughter <WH1323> of Tarshish <WH8659>: there is no more strength <WH4206>. strength: Heb. girdle

He stretched out <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> over the sea <WH3220>, he shook <WH7264> the kingdoms <WH4467>: the LORD <WH3068> hath given a commandment <WH6680> against the merchant <WH3667> city, to destroy <WH8045> the strong <WH4581> holds <WH4581> thereof. against: or, concerning a merchantman the merchant city: Heb. Canaan strong: or, strengths

And he said <WH559>, Thou shalt no more <WH3254> rejoice <WH5937>, O thou oppressed <WH6231> virgin <WH1330>, daughter <WH1323> of Zidon <WH6721>: arise <WH6965>, pass over <WH5674> to Chittim <WH3794>; there also shalt thou have no rest <WH5117>.

Behold the land <WH776> of the Chaldeans <WH3778>; this people <WH5971> was not, till the Assyrian <WH804> founded <WH3245> it for them that dwell in the wilderness <WH6728>: they set up <WH6965> the towers <WH971> thereof, they raised up <WH6209> the palaces <WH759> thereof; and he brought <WH7760> it to ruin <WH4654>.
Howl <WH3213>, ye ships <WH591> of Tarshish <WH8659>: for your strength <WH4581> is laid waste <WH7703>.

And it shall come to pass in that day <WH3117>, that Tyre <WH6865> shall be forgotten <WH7911> seventy <WH7657> years <WH8141>, according to the days <WH3117> of one <WH259> king <WH4428>: after the end <WH7093> of seventy <WH7657> years <WH8141> shall Tyre <WH6865> sing <WH7892> as an harlot <WH2181>. shall Tyre: Heb. it shall be unto Tyre as the song of an harlot

Take <WH3947> an harp <WH3658>, go about <WH5437> the city <WH5892>, thou harlot <WH2181> that hast been forgotten <WH7911>; make sweet <WH3190> melody <WH5059>, sing many <WH7235> songs <WH7892>, that thou mayest be remembered <WH2142>.

And it shall come to pass after the end <WH7093> of seventy <WH7657> years <WH8141>, that the LORD <WH3068> will visit <WH6485> Tyre <WH6865>, and she shall turn <WH7725> to her hire <WH868>, and shall commit fornication <WH2181> with all the kingdoms <WH4467> of the world <WH776> upon the face <WH6440> of the earth <WH127>.

And her merchandise <WH5504> and her hire <WH868> shall be holiness <WH6944> to the LORD <WH3068>: it shall not be treasured <WH686> nor laid up <WH2630>; for her merchandise <WH5504> shall be for them that dwell <WH3427> before <WH6440> the LORD <WH3068>, to eat <WH398> sufficiently <WH7654>, and for durable <WH6266> clothing <WH4374>. durable: Heb. old
